intro: Kohautia dolichostyla, commonly known as the long-styled kohautia, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its distinctive umbellate inflorescence. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its fruits are dry, ribbed berries that contain several seeds. Kohautia dolichostyla is notable for its unique floral structure and is of interest to botanists studying plant morphology and ecology.
